articles.title: Greetings to Latvian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Latvian President
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 20 sent a congratulatory message to Raimonds Vejonis upon his election as president of the Republic of Latvia.
					 The message wished the president of Latvia success in his responsible work for the country's development and the people's well-being, expressing belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Egyptian President
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, president of the Arab Republic of Egypt, on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the July 23 revolution, the auspicious holiday of the Egyptian people.
					 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the Egyptian people bigger progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Egyptian PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Egyptian PM
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Ibrahim Mahlab, prime minister of Egypt, on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the July 23 revolution, the national holiday of the Egyptian people.
					 The message wished the prime minister and government of Egypt bigger successes in their work for the country's socio-political stability and economic development and expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to his Egyptian counterpart Sameh Shoukry on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Pakistan Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Pakistan Appointed
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Thae Sop was appointed as DPRK ambassador to the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Film Show Held on Month of Solidarity with Cuban People
articles.content:
Film Show Held on Month of Solidarity with Cuban People
						
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the Chollima Hall of Culture on Wednesday on the occasion of the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					Present there on the invitation were German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					Present there were Kim Tong Son, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea who is also vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, officials concerned and Pyongyangites.
					
					Participants watched a Cuban documentary.

articles.title: Hyangha Revolutionary Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Hyangha Revolutionary Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
						
 Janggang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The Hyangha Revolutionary Site is drawing an endless stream of visitors in the run-up to the day of victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The site has revolutionary relics telling stories that President Kim Il Sung guided the Third Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea in the period of the past Fatherland Liberation War, arousing the entire party and army and all the people to the victory in the war.
					
					 A number of the visitors reached at least 2 000 on a day average this month. They included service persons, people from all walks of life and school youth and children.
					
					 They visited the house where the President stayed in December, Juche 39 (1950). They recollected the day when the President stayed up the whole night to prepare the report of the plenary meeting at the house. Visitors looked round the meeting place, a house where he talked to people, a spring site and other historic sites.
					
					 At the venue of the meeting in Hoedok-gol, they were briefed on the fact that the President delivered a report "The Present Situation and the Immediate Tasks" and made a conclusion, reviewing and analyzing the situation during six months of the war and set forth tasks for achieving the final victory.
					
					 They also went round historic relics dealing with facts that the President met with scientists, writers and artistes to unroll a blueprint for postwar rehabilitation and construction and indicated orientation for creative activities and paid deep attention to the issues of protecting lives of people and bringing their living to normal.
					
					 They were also briefed that the President personally let a soldier wear his own overcoat, concerned about his health before starting a long journey, and made sure that students, who had volunteered to fight on the front while studying in foreign countries, went back to study.

articles.title: Rules of Real Estate and Insurance in EDP Adopted
articles.content:
Rules of Real Estate and Insurance in EDP Adopted
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Rules of real estate and insurance in the economic development parks (EDP) were adopted according to the decision of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
					 The rule of real estate consists of seven chapters and 59 articles and the rule of insurance four chapters and 52 articles.
					
					 The rules deal with possession, registration and employment of real estates, their rent and rate, conclusion of insurance contract, formalities of insurance offices, etc. in the EDP.

articles.title: Length of Maternity Leave Extended in DPRK
articles.content:
Length of Maternity Leave Extended in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Article 66 of the Socialist Labor Law and article 33 of the law on protection of women's rights were amended by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
					 According to the amended articles, the length of maternity leave for working women was extended from 150 days to 240 days, 60 days before and 180 days after childbirth.
					
					 Experts say that the extension of maternity leave is of great significance in letting working women enjoy more social benefits.

articles.title: Fortitudinous Korean People and Victorious Korean War
articles.content:
Fortitudinous Korean People and Victorious Korean War
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The army and people of the DPRK won the great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953) by defeating the aggressor troops of the U.S. and its fifteen satellite countries and the south Korean puppets.
					 Through the genuine life they had led for five years after the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, they keenly felt that their motherland precisely means President Kim Il Sung who set up workers and peasants as masters of the country, masters of factories and land.
					
					 With the faith that they would surely win the war as long as they were led by Kim Il Sung, the Korean people came out in the sacred struggle to defend their motherland. And this faith was the essence of the mental power they displayed in the war.
					
					 Servicepersons unhesitatingly sacrificed their lives for the country to perform heroic feats in every battlefield, shouting "For the Party and the Leader!" And the people in the rear devoted their all to the wartime production and assistance to the front, overcoming all sorts of hardships while singing "Song of General Kim Il Sung".
					
					 During the war, more than 600 heroes emerged and many units of the Korean People's Army were conferred the title of guards.
					
					 The Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War clearly shows that the army and people firmly rallied around the Party and the leader with absolute trust in them and love for the country would surely emerge victorious.

articles.title: Universal Free Medical Care System Enforced in Wartime
articles.content:
Universal Free Medical Care System Enforced in Wartime
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- With the approach of the 62nd anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953), the Korean people recall with deep emotion the loving care shown by President Kim Il Sung for them in wartime.
					 It was one day in January Juche 41 (1952) that Kim Il Sung met an official to learn about treatment fees in hospitals. After acquainting himself in detail about it, he suggested enforcing free medical care system. He said there would be nothing to be spared for the people who were devoting their all to the victory in the war.
					
					 Under his wise guidance, a large number of medical workers had been trained and many hospitals and clinics rehabilitated during the war.
					
					 On this basis, the DPRK Cabinet decision No. 203 on enforcement of the universal free medical care system was released on November 13, 1952.
					
					 The history of loving care for the people is now creditably carried forward in the DPRK by supreme leader Kim Jong Un, who prioritizes the interests and conveniences of the people and hold them absolute.

articles.title: Loving Care Shown by Peerlessly Great Men of Mt. Paektu for War Veterans
articles.content:
Loving Care Shown by Peerlessly Great Men of Mt. Paektu for War Veterans
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un made sure that the fighting spirit displayed by war veterans and feats performed by them in the life-and-death battles for defending the party, the leader, the country and its people were glorified on the highest level.
					 The President made sure that a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on instituting the title of Hero of the Republic was promulgated on June 30, Juche 39 (1950).
					
					 The Victorious War Museum was opened on August 17, 1953 thanks to his noble moral obligation and care.
					
					 He saw to it that the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum was newly built on the bank of the Pothong River in April, 1974.
					
					 He took care of the war veterans so that they might perform miracles and innovations in the post-war rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction and glorify their lives.
					
					 Kim Jong Il made sure that the fighting spirit displayed in the 1950s lived on as powerful mental power promoting the era of Songun and building of a thriving nation.
					
					 His intention and will that respecting the war veterans is the tradition of the Korean revolution which won victories with arms are reflected in his "Respecting the Forerunners of the Revolution Is a Noble Moral Obligation of Revolutionaries" and other works.
					
					 He established the habit of respecting the war veterans throughout the society on the occasion of the 1st National Conference of Veterans held in July, 1993.
					
					 Meetings of veterans were held in each province, city, county and complexes across the country and all the war veterans and the persons who performed feats in the war were awarded the Order Commemorating the 40th Anniversary of the Victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War was erected as a monument to the heroes of the era.
					
					 War heroes' native places and alma maters and various other schools were renamed after them and their busts erected.
					
					 He made sure that war veterans joined the military parade celebrating the 60th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and let some of them lecture at the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum.
					
					 Kim Jong Un made sure that the 2nd National Conference of Veterans was held in July, 2012 as a grand festival of victors.
					
					 He had a photo session with the veterans and presented gifts to them with loving care.
					
					 The 3rd National Conference of Veterans was held on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The Order Commemorating the 60th Anniversary of the Victory in the Fatherland Liberation War was conferred to 47 075 veterans including anti-Japanese fighters, war veterans and persons of meritorious services during the war as they performed heroic merits in the war and made contributions to the building of a rich and powerful country after the war, too.
					
					 Celebration events took place in the presence of Kim Jong Un. They included a military parade and Pyongyang city mass demonstration for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War and a fireworks display.
					
					 The Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum was successfully built. It has in its centre sculpture "Victory" bearing his autograph "Tribute to the Great Years."
					
					 The Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery was built as a monumental structure.
					
					 Kim Jong Un took a measure to make a tradition to celebrate the war victory day with splendor every year and invite representatives of war veterans across the country to participate in the events to be held in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Carrying forward Spirit of Defending Country Displayed in 1950s
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Carrying forward Spirit of Defending Country Displayed in 1950s 
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- More than six decades have passed since the victory in the war and there exist not many war veterans. However, the heroic fighting spirit the war veterans displayed in the hard-fought battle fields for defending the country still lives on and powerfully encourages the service personnel and people of the DPRK to win fresh victories. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in an article. 
					 The revolutionary spirit of Paektu is the roots of the Korean revolution and the spirit of defending the country displayed in the 1950s serves as a powerful mental weapon which helped make a history of great victory in the war of Songun Korea as it means its brilliant succession, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The spirit of defending the country displayed in the 1950s is, indeed, the most precious mental legacy. 
					
					 The above-said spirit represents the noble spirit of patriotic loyalty, a combination of the belief in the excellence of our leader, patriotism, the outlook on the leader and the country. Herein lie tremendous vitality of the spirit of defending the country displayed during the war and truth of patriotism to be inherited by posterity. The defenders of the country in the 1950s proved in practice truth that protecting the leader means the greatest patriotism. Their feats will go down in the history of the country. 
					
					 The spirit of defending the country displayed in the 1950s which was created and given steady continuity under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward as the DPRK has Marshal Kim Jong Un at the helm of the Korean revolution. 
					
					 The spirit displayed in the 1950s to bring earlier the day of victory in the war thanks to the united might of the servicepersons and people always lives on. They are advancing like the wind, holding Kim Jong Un in high esteem as the center of the leadership and unity and sharing thought, breath and pace with him. 
					
					 The DPRK is sure to win the final victory in the standoff with imperialism and the U.S. as there are the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, Songun brilliant commander of Paektu, and the service personnel and people of the DPRK who are equipped with the above-said spirit.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Puppet Forces' Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Puppet Forces' Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign 
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet chief executive is recklessly taking the lead in the smear campaign against the DPRK while talking about someone's "instability of social system" and "unpredictable provocation". Echoing her outbursts, coteries of the puppet authorities and ultra-right conservative media are busy floating a flurry of misinformation in a bid to mislead public opinion.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces' heinous anti-DPRK smear campaign is a product of their sinister intention to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK and lay higher hurdles in the way of north-south dialogue. 
					
					 Their anti-DPRK smear campaign is no more than symptoms of doom of those who are taken aback by the ever stronger single-mined unity of the DPRK.
					
					 Their ever noisier anti-DPRK false propaganda would get them nowhere.
					
					 The regime and socialism in the DPRK remain unfazed in face of any desperate efforts on the part of the U.S. imperialists and the puppet forces.
					
					 The DPRK is an invincible socialist fortress and great flower garden of the single-minded unity deeply embedded in the minds of the people.
					
					 Persistent efforts made by the puppet forces to ratchet up their sinister anti-DPRK smear campaign, denying this stark reality, would only precipitate their miserable doom.
					
					 Tricksters should not blame the deadly retaliatory blows to their den. Chongwadae, the puppet Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Unification and gangsters of the puppet Intelligence Service who are behind conservative media and human scum and media persons involved in the false propaganda will not be free from this retaliation.
					
					 The group of traitors hell-bent on the anti-DPRK smear campaign should bear in mind that they are always targeted by service personnel of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Japan Bound to Face History's Stern Judgment; Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan Bound to Face History's Stern Judgment; Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, modern industrial establishments of Japan were registered as world cultural heritage at the 39th meeting of the World Heritage Committee of UNESCO.
					 Almost all those industrial establishments are the places where people of Korea and other Asian countries were forced to do mediaeval slave labor after being taken there.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The World Heritage Committee of UNESCO disregarded the feelings of the Asian countries still suffering the wounds inflicted upon them by Japan in the past and is playing the role of a marionette, siding with Japan.
					
					 It is the undeniable truth of history that Japan forced slave labor on Asians in the past and that is a crime.
					
					 Then what is the attitude of Japan?
					
					 Whenever Japan's past crimes were brought into question, it made every desperate effort to deny and justify them.
					
					 Lurking behind this behavior of Japan is a sinister aim to deny its past history of invasion and crimes against the humanity at any cost. This is little short of its intention to repeat its past history.
					
					 Japan is unable to foresee even an inch ahead.
					
					 Japan chooses the way of its self-destruction. History remains fair as it will not change due to anyone's subjective point of view. Japan is making desperate efforts to keep its past crimes buried into oblivion, but it will certainly face history's stern judgment any time. It would be well advised to bear this in mind and sincerely admit its wrongs and apologize for them, though belatedly.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Demand Authorities Disband IS
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Demand Authorities Disband IS 
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- More than 70 religious, civic and public organizations in the area of Taejon, south Korea formed the Taejon movement headquarters for defending democracy and held a press conference in Taejon on July 20.
					 The organizations said that the Intelligence Service is claiming that the eavesdropping hacking program is "targeted on the north" and it purchased the program for the "purpose of research development", but this is no more than an artifice to deceive the people. 
					
					 The IS has used a program capable of monitoring everything including the private life of people any time as it pleases, the organizations said, adding:
					
					 The IS and the present chief executive should properly understand the gravity of the situation and take measures including hearing and special inspection for thoroughly probing the truth.
					
					 The organizations demanded the authorities dismantle the IS which committed such illegal acts as interference in election, fabrication of spying cases and surveillance over civilians.

articles.title: S. Korean Marine Corps Plans to Stage Large-scale Naval Firing Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Marine Corps Plans to Stage Large-scale Naval Firing Drill 
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hankook Ilbo on Tuesday said the marine corps announced that it would stage a large naval firing exercise on islands in the West Sea of Korea, the biggest hotspot in the sea, this week. 
					 The warmongers are going to bring all firepower weapons including different types of artillery pieces to the islands under the pretext of coping with someone's "infiltration into the south".

articles.title: Human Rights Abuses Unabated in S. Korean Puppet Army
articles.content:
Human Rights Abuses Unabated in S. Korean Puppet Army 
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- A soldier of the south Korean puppet Marine Corps attempted suicide, unable to bear harsh violence by superiors, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People. 
					 In May three newcomers suffered violence from their superiors a few days after their posting at a unit of the marine corps. 
					
					 They beat the heads of the soldiers with helmets and kicked them when they fell.
					
					 A private first class jumped from the second floor of a building to commit suicide, unable to endure such harsh violence.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Group's Submission to Japan Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Group's Submission to Japan Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. in a commentary on July 17 denounced the south Korean puppet group for shutting its eyes to the brutal atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialists and submitting to Japan.
					 The commentary accused Park Geun Hye of crying out for mending the relations with Japan while talking about new era and strategic interests. 
					
					 Park Geun Hye, a lackey in realizing Japan's sinister scenario for reinvasion, is bound to meet the nation's punishment, it noted.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by Syrian Papers
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by Syrian Papers
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Syrian papers carried articles in praise of the exploits of President Kim Il Sung on the 21st anniversary of his demise.
					 Tishrin on July 6 said in an article that the august name of the President, a national hero and internationalist fighter, would shine forever like the sun with the 20th century.
					
					 The President sincerely helped many countries in their struggle to free themselves from the colonial rule and build a new society and conducted energetic activities for the development of the world socialist movement and the non-aligned movement, it noted.
					
					 Al Usbou Adabi on July 5 carried an article titled "Outstanding great man".
					
					  The article said the august name of the President is shining with the 20th century which witnessed the greatest changes in carving out the destiny of humankind. 
					
					 Whoever met him was attracted by his noble humanity and virtue as a great man. Those with differing political views and religious faith and even the politicians of the countries in hostile relationship with the DPRK were attracted by his noble personality.

articles.title: Humankind Will Remember Kim Il Sung Forever
articles.content:
Humankind Will Remember Kim Il Sung Forever
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Special write-ups accompanied by portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung were posted on the Austrian and Congolese websites on the 21st anniversary of his demise.
					 An article titled "Sun of all people" was posted by the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK on its website on July 7.
					
					 The article said: 
					
					 The image of the tender-hearted President is remembered by the world people like the sun with bright rays, warm humanity and great attraction.
					
					 He founded the Juche idea, man-centered revolutionary theory, indicating the way for humankind to follow in the era of independence.
					
					 He pursued benevolent politics out of warm humanity.
					
					 His noble personality attracted all people.
					
					 He, the sun of all people, will be always alive in the hearts of mankind.
					
					 An article was posted on the Congolese website Congo-Site on July 2 to praise his sacred revolutionary career and exploits.

articles.title: Anniversary of Conferment of Title of DPRK Marshal on Kim Jong Un Celebrated in Benin, Nigeria
articles.content:
Anniversary of Conferment of Title of DPRK Marshal on Kim Jong Un Celebrated in Benin, Nigeria
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Benin and a photo exhibition and film show in Nigeria on July 17, the third anniversary of the conferment of the title of the DPRK Marshal on supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 Displayed at the venue of the photo exhibition were pictures documenting his exploits.
					
					 Also on display there were photos showing the true picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 Participants of the film show watched a Korean film introducing the Songdowon International Children's Camp.
					
					 The chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" who doubles as chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said that Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is the great idea illuminating the road ahead of the people of African countries, extending warm congratulations to him on the above-said occasion.
					
					 The chief of the Benin Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism who doubles as rector of the Cotonou Institute of Journalism of Benin noted that under his wise guidance the DPRK is demonstrating its might as an independent power which the U.S. dares not to provoke and a strong fortress defending peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.

articles.title: Korean Film Shows Held Abroad to Observe Month of Anti-U.S. Joint Struggle
articles.content:
Korean Film Shows Held Abroad to Observe Month of Anti-U.S. Joint Struggle
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows were held by the Juche Idea Study Society of Delhi, India, the General Union of the Algerian Workers, a company of Angola and a furniture factory in Abuja, Nigeria from June 29 to July 16 on the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 Films shown included Korean films "My Country Has Emerged Victorious by Dint of Single-minded Unity" and "Provoker of Korean War."
					
					 The chairman of the Juche Idea Study Society of Delhi, India said:
					
					 The U.S. provoked the Korean war on June 25, 1950 for the purpose of laying a springboard for realizing its wild ambition to dominate the world.
					
					 However, the army and people of the DPRK prevailed over the enemies' numerical and technical superiority with politico-ideological, strategic and tactical superiority.
					
					 The U.S. was compelled to sign the Armistice Agreement on July 27, 1953.
					
					 This day is remembered by the Korean people as the day of great victory when they shattered to smithereens the myth of the U.S. "mightiness" and defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country.

articles.title: Solidarity for Korean People Expressed in India, Guinea, Nigeria
articles.content:
Solidarity for Korean People Expressed in India, Guinea, Nigeria
						
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- A seminar, lecture and film shows took place in India, Guinea and Nigeria from July 14 to 16 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 Films shown included Korean film "Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum" and "Provoker of Korean War."
					
					 The chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India said in a speech:
					
					 The U.S. occupied south Korea under the mask of "liberator" in the wake of the end of the Second World War. It prodded the south Korean army into launching surprise invasion of the northern half of Korea on June 25, 1950, prompted by its wild ambition to dominate the world.
					
					 More than six decades have passed since then but the U.S. remains unchanged in its hostile policy toward the DPRK, bringing the dark clouds of a new war to hang over the Korean peninsula every year.
					
					 However, the DPRK is no longer a young country which used to be in the 1950s.
					
					 The DPRK is a politico-ideological power in which all service personnel and people are singled-mindedly united around the leader and a military power, nuclear weapons state and satellite manufacturer and launcher fully ready for defence and offensive.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK have the firm will not miss the chance but blow up the U.S., the source of war and den of evils, if it ignites a war at any cost.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al electo presidente de Latvia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al electo presidente de Latvia 
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion a Raimonds Vejonis, electo presidente de la Republica de Latvia.
					El remitente expresa conviccion de que las relaciones entre la RPDC y Latvia se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas en el futuro, y le desea exitos al mandatario en sus labores responsables para el desarrollo del pais y el bienestar del pueblo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al pueblo egipcio por Revolucion de 23 de Julio
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al pueblo egipcio por Revolucion de 23 de Julio
						
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 22 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Arabe de Egipto, Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, con motivo del 63o aniversario de la Revolucion del 23 de Julio, jubilosa fiesta del pueblo egipcio.
					Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre ambos paises seguiran ampliandose y desarrollandose tambien en lo adelante, el remitente deseo de todo corazon mayor progreso y prosperidad al amistoso pueblo egipcio.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador de RPDC en Pakistan
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador de RPDC en Pakistan
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ACNC) -- Segun un decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Thae Sop fue nombrado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en la Republica Islamica de Pakistan.

articles.title: Encuentro de cine por mes de solidaridad con pueblo cubano
articles.content:
Encuentro de cine por mes de solidaridad con pueblo cubano
						
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ACNC) -- En ocasion de esta efemeride, tuvo lugar hoy en la Casa Cultural Chollima la proyeccion filmica.
					A la ocasion fueron invitados el embajador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana en Corea.
					
					Tomaron parte en el acto Kim Tong Son, vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea y del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba y otros funcionarios junto con los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Los participantes vieron un documental cubano.
